NATIONAL NEWS






Wisconsin Energy net income declines: But natural gas profits up on higher rates, cold



May 2--Higher natural gas rates and cold winter weather helped boost profit from sales of natural gas by $28 million in the first quarter, Wisconsin Energy Corp. said Tuesday.  But those higher rates weren't enough to offset the $44 million in higher costs of electricity the company's utility business, We Energies, had to buy when its power plants were out of service for maintenance.


May 2, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Climate experts to devise new clean air protocols



May 2--The governor's climate experts will meet with environmentalists to work out a new clean air plan to supersede one that has been gathering dust for about two years.  Roger Smith, Connecticut Climate Coordinator, said government agency representatives will sit down with business leaders, environmental groups, academicians and others in the next few days to jump-start the state's Climate ...

Napocor to bid out Pagbilao coal supply



May 2--NATIONAL Power Corp. (Napocor) is bidding out the coal supply contract of the Pagbilao power plant at a cost of a billion pesos.  Documents obtained from the state-run power-generation company show that it has invited seven prequalified bidders for five shipments worth P1.24 billion. The approved budget for the contract is about P249 million per shipment at a reference price of $67 a ...

Governor's mansion going green: Installating solar panels first step toward cutting power usage at official residence



May 2--ALBANY -- Solar panels should start showing up at the Executive Mansion this summer under an effort to make it the nation's first "green" residence for a governor.  The goal is to meet about 40 percent of the mansion's electrical needs from the sun by next year, First Lady Silda Wall Spitzer said Tuesday. "Starting today, the mansion will also function as a sustainable building," she said. ...

Calvert Cliffs is UniStar's new site



BALTIMORE, May. 1 (UPI) --  Maryland's Calvert Cliffs nuclear plant is the site for UniStar Nuclear's first new license application, which the company says will pave the way for more. North Country lawmakers want more power lines



LANCASTER, N.H. - Lawmakers from northern New Hampshire say the region needs more power lines to handle the output from future power projects. The legislative delegation from Coos County sent a resolution to Gov. John Lynch asking him to promote upgrading transmission lines so any new power generated by wind or wood power plants, for instance, can move into the regional power grid.

Washington Gas Customers, Area Residents Can Now Call 811 Before They Dig



Washington Gas customers and residents in the District of Columbia, Maryland and Virginia today have a new, convenient telephone number to call prior to engaging in any project that requires digging. Broadband Over Power Lines - Is It for Real?



While broadband services have penetrated a large portion of the United States, many rural communities still have few options beyond dial-up. BANGKOK, Thailand: The European Union called on developing countries Tuesday to take action to reduce greenhouse gases, as delegates worked to finalize a report detailing measures needed to save the planet. Mosenergo begins construction of new power unit in Moscow



- Russian electricity provider Mosenergo has started constructing a new power unit at its CHPP-26 power station in Moscow, according to state power firm Unified Energy System (RAO UES). The unit will use fourth-generation combined-cycle technology to help significantly improve the plant's performance. Mirant Completes Sale of Six U.S. Gas Plants



ATLANTA, May 1 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Mirant Corporation (NYSE: MIR) announced today that it has completed the sale of six U.S. natural gas fired plants to Broadway Generating Company, LLC, a member of the LS Power Group. The net proceeds to Mirant from the sale, after paying transaction expenses and retiring $83 million of project-related debt, were $1.306 billion. The following U.S.


May 1, 2007 PR Newswire



GE to Supply Additional 600 Megawatts of Wind Turbines to Invenergy



ATLANTA--(BUSINESS WIRE)--GE Energy (NYSE:GE), the leading supplier of technology and services for the U.S. wind industry, will provide an additional 600 megawatts of wind turbines to Invenergy Wind LLC for 2008 projects in the United States and Canada. Invenergy previously announced the purchase of 600 megawatts of GE Energy wind turbines for 2007 projects.

Taiwan Power Shortage May Be Bigger Threat Than China Missiles



4:41 PM tdworld.com An impending power shortage could cause blackouts in Taiwan within three years and weaken the nation's economy, according to a Bloomberg report.
